interventions:
New Entity
> An entity refers to any person or group of persons that are remotely autonomous, not simply specific NPCs and monsters. For inspirations, I recommend using `!npc` commands or `!portent`

Entity Positive
> Something good happens to an entity, the specifics of which can be determined by asking questions using `!oracle`

Entity Negative
> Something bad happens to an entity, the specifics of which can be determined by asking questions using `!oracle`

Advance Plot
> A plot is an unresolved story hook or thread that usually acts as a goal of some kind. Advancing a plot pushes an unresolved hook forward.

Regress Plot
> A plot is an unresolved story hook or thread that usually acts as a goal of some kind. Regressing a plot should help the adventure progress, just by hindering a certain goal or plot point.

Wild
> Something unexpected! This is the option that allows for sudden twists of fate. Because a wild Intervention is so vague in what it can represent, I recommend you use `!portent` to figure out what the heck it actually means.
